Package org.unibl.etf.tks

Class Calculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unibl.etf.tks.Calculator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalculatorAdvanced
    public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a simple class used to demonstrate basic arithmetic operations, such as addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. It has one member which represents current state of the calculator and which changes after every calculation.
    Since:
    2022-11-25
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marko Radusinovic

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Calculator()
      Constructs a Calculator object with a default initial value of its state of 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentValue

        public java.lang.Double getCurrentValue()
        Retrieves the current current value stored in the calculator.
        Returns:
        The value stored in the calculator.

      • setCurrentValue

        public void setCurrentValue​(java.lang.Double currentValue)
        Sets the current current value stored in the calculator.
        Parameters:
        currentValue - The value that will be stored in the calculator and that will represent its state.

      • calculate

        public void calculate​(java.lang.Double value,
                      char operator)
               throws NotSupportedOperationException,
                      DivisionByZeroException
        Performs simple arithmetic operations which include addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. whereby the first operand in the operation is the value stored in the calculator, and the second operand is passed as a second argument of the method. The result of the operation will be stored in the calculator as its current state.
        Parameters:
        value - The second operand in the operation that will be performed by the calculator.
        operator - Indicates which operation will be performed. Supported operations are +, -, * and /.
        Throws:
        NotSupportedOperationException - Thrown if parameter operation is not one of +, -, * or /.
        DivisionByZeroException - Thrown if parameter operation is / and parameter value is 0.
